title: Thinking in React code examples broken
body:
On this page:

https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/thinking-in-react.html

The jsfiddle based code samples are missing; I see an empty block instead. Note that you have to go down a bit; the JSON example and graphic are working, but the jsfiddle JS code samples aren't.

This is with Fedora Linux 20, with FF 28 and Chrome 34.0.1847.132

I tested it on my Android mobile phone with Chrome yesterday, and the fiddles are there. But not on my desktop, yesterday or today.

When I open a fiddle mentioned in the page by hand:

http://jsfiddle.net/3Vs3Q/embedded/

I do get it on the page.

When I turn on Firebug I get the following errors:

```
Blocked loading mixed active content "http://jsfiddle.net/6wQMG/embedded/"
Blocked loading mixed active content "http://jsfiddle.net/QvHnx/embedded/"
Blocked loading mixed active content "http://jsfiddle.net/3Vs3Q/embedded/"
```

In Chrome dev tools:

```
[blocked] The page at 'https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/thinking-in-react.html' was loaded over HTTPS, but ran insecure content from 'http://jsfiddle.net/6wQMG/embedded/': this content should also be loaded over HTTPS.
thinking-in-react.html:451
[blocked] The page at 'https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/thinking-in-react.html' was loaded over HTTPS, but ran insecure content from 'http://jsfiddle.net/QvHnx/embedded/': this content should also be loaded over HTTPS.
thinking-in-react.html:495
[blocked] The page at 'https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/thinking-in-react.html' was loaded over HTTPS, but ran insecure content from 'http://jsfiddle.net/3Vs3Q/embedded/': this content should also be loaded over HTTPS.
```

Those seem relevant. Some form of content security policy is kicking in for me that isn't kicking in for others (or on my phone).

See also closed issue #1467
